decks.notes: The deck focuses on using energy-generating cards like Woodweaver's Puzzleknot and Aether Hub to power out Aetherworks Marvel, which allows you to cheat powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger into play. The deck also includes cards like Glimmer of Genius and Rogue Refiner to help dig for key combo pieces and provide card advantage. Additionally, the deck runs countermagic like Negate and Censor to protect its combo pieces, while removal spells like Harnessed Lightning and Dissenter's Deliverance provide additional utility. The overall goal is to ramp into powerful threats and overwhelm the opponent quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively deploy creatures with strong synergy between them, utilizing cards like Winding Constrictor to boost their power and abilities. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push while building up an aggressive board presence. Cards like Nissa, Voice of Zendikar and Liliana, the Last Hope provide additional value and utility. The aim is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient threats and disruption, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of creature combat and incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on using energy generation and Aetherworks Marvel to cheat out powerful creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck includes cards like Woodweaver's Puzzleknot, Attune with Aether, and Harnessed Lightning to generate and use energy. Glimmer of Genius helps to find the combo pieces, while Censor and Dissenter's Deliverance provide some protection and utility. Rogue Refiner and Chandra, Flamecaller offer additional value and card draw. The goal is to activate Aetherworks Marvel, spin the wheel, and put Ulamog into play for a game-winning attack.

The deck focuses on ramping up energy quickly using cards like Attune with Aether and Aetherworks Marvel to cheat out powerful creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. Support cards like Rogue Refiner and Whirler Virtuoso help to stabilize the board and generate additional energy. The deck also includes spells like Negate and Censor for control and protection. The goal is to ultimately overwhelm the opponent with massive threats like Ulamog while maintaining board presence and control through energy generation and card draw.

The deck focuses on using energy counters to power up Aetherworks Marvel, allowing you to cheat out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. It also includes cards like Whirler Virtuoso and Rogue Refiner to generate additional energy and provide card advantage. Nahiri, the Harbinger and Chandra, Flamecaller are included for additional removal and card filtering options. The deck aims to quickly ramp up energy production and overwhelm your opponent with massive creatures while controlling the board with removal spells.

The main strategy of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent quickly by playing efficient creatures and utilizing strong removal spells. The deck focuses on ramping up mana with cards like Attune with Aether and Servant of the Conduit to cast powerful threats like Glorybringer and Bristling Hydra. It also has access to strong control elements with cards like Elder Deep-Fiend and Chandra, Torch of Defiance, allowing the player to both establish a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing energy cards to power up Aetherworks Marvel in order to quickly bring out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. It also includes control elements like counterspells and removal to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The game plan is to ramp up energy quickly, play Aetherworks Marvel, activate it to put a big Eldrazi creature into play, and close out the game with the overwhelming power of these high-cost threats.

The deck revolves around assembling the Aetherworks Marvel combo to cheat out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. Using energy-generating spells like Woodweaver's Puzzleknot and Aether Hub, the deck aims to ramp up quickly and control the game with counterspells like Negate and Censor. Card draw and filtering with Glimmer of Genius and Rogue Refiner help find the combo pieces faster. The deck also includes some versatility with cards like Confiscation Coup and Baral's Expertise to deal with various threats on the board.

The primary focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly build up a strong board presence with creatures like Winding Constrictor and Walking Ballista while utilizing cards like Grim Flayer and Traverse the Ulvenwald to maintain card advantage and consistency. The deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent early on and win through efficient creature combat and powerful synergy between creatures and planeswalkers like Nissa, Voice of Zendikar and Liliana, the Last Hope. It also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Never // Return to deal with opposing threats.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive creature plays and efficient removal spells. The deck focuses on the synergy between cards like Winding Constrictor and Grim Flayer to generate value and maintain board presence. The inclusion of cards like Walking Ballista and Verdurous Gearhulk provide additional threats and ways to finish off the opponent. The deck also utilizes cards like Nissa, Voice of Zendikar and Liliana, the Last Hope to generate additional value and provide additional support for the creatures in the deck.

This mono black aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a horde of powerful zombie creatures. Using cards like Liliana's Mastery and Lord of the Accursed to boost the team, while also utilizing removal spells like Grasp of Darkness and Fatal Push to clear the way. The deck is designed to be fast and aggressive, quickly building a board presence and applying pressure to the opponent. The key strategy is to constantly be attacking and creating zombie tokens to wear down the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive Mono Black strategy. By utilizing cards like Relentless Dead and Lord of the Accursed, the deck aims to swarm the board with creatures and pump them up with cards like Liliana's Mastery and Dark Salvation. The deck also includes disruptive removal spells like Grasp of Darkness and Fatal Push to deal with any threats from the opponent. With a focus on zombie creatures and generating tokens, this deck aims to quickly overrun the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on utilizing energy counters to power up creatures like Voltaic Brawler, Longtusk Cub, and Bristling Hydra, while also providing protection with cards like Blossoming Defense. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and pump spells like Larger Than Life and Invigorated Rampage. Fling can be used as a finishing move to deal a large amount of damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to maintain a strong board presence and apply consistent pressure to force the opponent into a defensive position.

This deck focuses on using Aetherworks Marvel to cheat big creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger onto the battlefield quickly. It aims to generate energy through cards like Woodweaver's Puzzleknot and Aether Hub, allowing for consistent activations of Aetherworks Marvel. Cards like Whirler Virtuoso and Rogue Refiner provide additional energy generation and card draw to keep the engine running smoothly. The deck also includes removal and countermagic to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on ramping up energy quickly using cards like Attune with Aether and Aether Hub to power out Aetherworks Marvel. The key goal is to get Aetherworks Marvel out as quickly as possible to start using its ability to cheat out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes counterspells and removal to protect the combo and maintain control of the game until the big threats hit the battlefield. It's all about setting up the Marvel combo and overwhelming the opponent with huge threats.

The deck focuses on generating Marvelous Energy to quickly ramp up and play powerful spells like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. By using Aetherworks Marvel to cheat expensive creatures into play, the deck can overwhelm opponents with massive threats while maintaining control with counterspells like Negate. The energy generation from cards like Servant of the Conduit and Woodweaver's Puzzleknot allows for explosive plays and the ability to consistently hit Marvel activations. Additionally, the deck includes versatile cards like Whirler Virtuoso and Glimmer of Genius to provide utility and card advantage.
